posts.name:
Richard King
Richard King
posts.content:
Friday, January 17, 2025

Friday’s weekly LinkedIn job posting report. I nice bump to kick off the new year. A 20%-ish uptick in jobs posted. Remote and hybrid job seekers are seeing fewer and fewer options. Abysmal figures for this past week. Yikes!

Jobs posted: 1,832,422
Remote: 113,046 (6.2%)
Hybrid: 85,805 (4.7%)

comments.commentText: I'm surprised to see more remote over hybrid, although I can assume that many of those jobs posted fall into the hybrid bucket.

posts.name:
Raj Sanghvi
Raj Sanghvi
posts.content:
Nikhil Kamath’s podcast with PM Modi and Raj Shamani’s conversation with CM Kejriwal have sparked conversations everywhere. 

What started as a niche format has now become a powerful medium for sharing ideas and stories.

Creators like,, andare leading this shift. They’ve shown how podcasts can bring meaningful discussions to the forefront and connect with millions in a way that feels personal and real.

It’s exciting to see how podcasts have grown into a career path, something that wasn’t even considered possible a few years ago.

This is just the beginning of a journey that’s changing how we consume and share knowledge.

The impact they’re making today is just a glimpse of where this industry is headed tomorrow.

comments.commentText: Um um.. . These podcasters and our MPs and MLAs are same. Podcasters start with a specific niche for specific audience. Now once they got the grip over their audience, its upto them, Whatever they serve the audience will buy it. Everything is new to Indian audience at digital platform. Absolutely it is a great way to connect with the masses but it's a greater way to manipulate the same mass. That's what all three are doing. India is most confused society today. Because people are not able to realise and feel the pain of their unemployment because they have just started laughing on vulgarity thinking it a dark comedy. Most of the audience is following these youtubers because some of their cool friends and relatives are following them. They actually don't have any opinion and understanding the core concepts of it.

Over rated hype PR stunt!!!!
 ......rather challenge these podcasters to do interview on real FOCUSed political ideology called #prajakeeya#

posts.name:
Jerry Rassamni
Jerry Rassamni
posts.content:
At Tesla's "We, Robot" Event: A Glimpse into the Future 

Elon Musk introduced the 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝘂𝘀 𝗵𝘂𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗼𝗶𝗱 𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗼𝘁 for the second time, saying: "𝗜𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗱𝗼 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝗶𝗺𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲."

Optimus is more than a robot—it’s a revolution. Designed with Tesla’s most advanced AI and robotics, it promises to do everything humans can do, and more.

Here’s what the future with Optimus could look like:
 𝗧𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝗿𝗼𝘂𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗼𝗿 𝗵𝗮𝘇𝗮𝗿𝗱𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗷𝗼𝗯𝘀
 𝗔𝘀𝘀𝗶𝘀𝘁 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗼𝗿 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗵𝗼𝘂𝘀𝗲𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸
 𝗔𝗶𝗱 𝗶𝗻 𝘀𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀 𝗹𝗶𝗸𝗲 𝗺𝗮𝗻𝘂𝗳𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗻𝗴, 𝗹𝗼𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰𝘀, 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗽𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗹𝗼𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻

Elon’s vision goes beyond functionality. He aims to 𝗿𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗸 𝗵𝘂𝗺𝗮𝗻-𝗺𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 and integrate AI seamlessly into all levels of human activity.

 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁’𝘀 𝗡𝗲𝘅𝘁?
A world where robots adapt to us, making life easier, safer, and more efficient.

If Optimus can do “whatever you can imagine,” the possibilities are endless. 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘁𝗮𝘀𝗸 𝘄𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗮 𝗵𝘂𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗼𝗶𝗱 𝗿𝗼𝗯𝗼𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗹𝗲 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗲? Let’s discuss in the comments!

comments.commentText:
Just how would safety be ensured if they are going to be used in care giving roles? 

What happens if it uses excessive force (ie if feedback sensors failed)?

What happens if it fails to detect a child in close proximity?

What if it just simply falls over onto a child or other fragile person?

Would OSHA, or any other body approve it for working alongside humans in a factory.
It would need UL, CE or other certification just as any other machine does.

Perhaps this is why Tesla would want deregulation.

Thank you for sharing these valuable insights! It's also important to recognize that a company's ability to innovate and adapt to market changes can significantly impact its valuation. In today's fast-paced business environment, agility and a forward-thinking mindset are crucial for maintaining a competitive edge. Additionally, fostering a strong organizational culture that emphasizes continuous learning and development can drive long-term success and sustainable growth.

posts.name:
Marissa Rodriguez
Marissa Rodriguez
posts.content:
Most People Struggle to Grow Their eCommerce Business.

Can eCommerce thrive from anywhere?

Absolutely.

For the past 3.5 years, I've proven it by generating $75M in DTC revenue for North American brands—all while living in Greece.

And, I've kept all of my same clients.

Here's what I've learned about successful remote working:

1️⃣ Timezone Advantage

Being 7–10 hours ahead keeps me proactive.
By the time my clients start their day, strategies are already in motion.

2️⃣ Master Time Batching

All client calls are packed into mid-week sprints.
This setup leaves Mondays and Fridays for deep work and creativity, preventing burnout.

3️⃣ Stay Ultra-Connected

From Slack to WhatsApp, I ensure I'm reachable.
Reliability isn't just important—it's vital.

4️⃣ Build Your Dream Team

I've assembled a network of rockstar collaborators.
When you find someone reliable and results-driven, keep them close.

5️⃣ Be Ready to Execute

Remote work isn't where you learn; it's where you apply expertise.

6️⃣ Develop Self-Discipline

There are many times that I'm working and everyone else is not.
And there are moments when I'm not working, and everyone else is.

Without self-discipline, you can't succeed.

________________

Remote work is more than a trend—it's a skill.

Combine expertise with systems and people, and watch location become irrelevant. 

 Want to learn the strategy behind $75,000,000 in eComm revenue from Greece?

Let me show you MY strategy.

 Join my FREE live training on January 30th or 31st.
 Register HERE:

comments.commentText: And let me guess you only work an hour a day.
Evan Weber Umm no, I do 6 hour sprints of back to back video calls Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with my teams.

posts.name:

Anil Kaul
posts.content:
Uncovering Hidden Costs in Homebuying
Did you know that hidden fees from appraisal management companies (AMCs) alone have cost homebuyers $12.3 billion over five years? Unfortunately, this is just one example of how the system can quietly work against buyers.
In my latest article, I dive into how hidden costs can stack up in the homebuying process and why having an advocate in your corner is essential. With the right tools and guidance, buyers can navigate these challenges confidently and save money along the way.

posts.name:
Alex Turnbull
Alex Turnbull
posts.content:
"AI isn't just replacing us–it's watching us first.”

Last week I was in a side room at a tech meet up with the VP of Engineering of a $200M ARR SaaS platform. They were showing me something on their laptop. Here's what they shared:

"AI isn't just replacing us–it's watching us first. 30% productivity gains at Salesforce?

That's from AI studying every workflow, every pattern, and every process.

Benioff just announced: zero engineering hires in 2025, but 2,000 new salespeople instead?

January layoffs aren't random; they're evolutionary.

They need humans to sell what AI helps build.

Everything feels like we're at an inflection point. Nothing about this feels optional. Nothing about this path seems reversible."

We're in the most transformative tech shift that any of us have experienced.

You weren't a genius when AI was just hype.

You weren't ready when AI was just watching.

And you're not obsolete now that it's learning.

We're all part of this transition. Part of this evolution.

Yes, there are things we can do to adapt and thrive.

But also, remember to understand what's really happening:

When AI can handle 80% of routine work by learning from our patterns, when Salesforce completely freezes engineering hiring but adds 2,000 salespeople, we're not just entering a new era.

We're entering the next phase of human-AI collaboration.

The question isn't if AI will change engineering.

It's how we'll evolve with it.

Like every technological revolution, those who adapt first will shape what comes next.

comments.commentText: Ai will make humans more productive and effective than ever. You can resist or you can use it to your advantage. Only one way will serve you…
It’s surreal to think that AI isn’t just replacing tasks, it’s studying and learning from us to optimize how we work but that's real!!
Siddharth Verma Yeah, it's a bit dystopian. From a completely objective pov however, training AI off employee data for proprietary datasets is a great idea

posts.name:
Michael Kainatsky
Michael Kainatsky
posts.content:
It’s the start that stops most people. 


This is the biggest challenge most people face.

For years, I’ve pondered what a possible solution could be?

People spend a lot of time thinking but far less time, doing.

Since I am not that smart, this is all I’ve been able to come up with.

3 very simple steps.

• Always start today
• Always quit tomorrow
• Repeat daily

But always focus on today as a priority.

“You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.”
— Zig Ziglar

Yours truthfully,

comments.commentText: Used to be this way Michael, overthinking everything. Every business message, every video edit, etc. Then I just said "enough" and began going all out.
not enough of either is most harmful.
Or…just stop thinking. Start doing. Keep doing.
only the penitent man shall pass.
